messages.message: What kind of feedback on xlsx/csv querying is going to be useful here? I'm running into inaccuracies on basic, non-mathematical queries and don't want to spam this channel. Should I just use the thumbs down feedback button in the app? Do the reviewers of feedback submitted that way get the full context of the file being queried or should I be very descriptive about what went wrong?
thumbs down will work, and the team can go look at your project
Out of curiosity, will that be the case for public users as well? We'll have access to their projects when looking at feedback?
yes we will have legal language for file retention and using a user's data to improve our product
ideally all these feedback / metrics are collected automatically; in the beginning it'll be manual, but can't stay that for too long

@Kerry I wanted to check with you on the legal/privacy here - so we are able to use our user’s data to improve our product? e.g. if someone downvotes an answer, we can add that to a benchmark somewhere?

@Varun Jain do you know what happens right now when an answer is downvoted? where is that stored / can we query it somewhere?

Right now it's stored in the chat project file, the immediate next goal is to put it somewhere we can query yes

On privacy -- i should probably let legal address this, but I believe we will have terms similar to open AI for the public AI Hub.
https://openai.com/policies/privacy-policy
kk, I’ll follow up with legal to confirm. I think this is something someone on my team can work on

@lydia - here are the terms of service and privacy policy

• Terms of service: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ezjik2DxRHxpwXrd3H3to-SRFKOnpVwZM-tvYXOJEp0/edit
• Privacy policy is the same as for Instabase platform: https://instabase.com/privacy-policy/
TLDR:
• We explicitly ask for permission to use user feedback to improve the product. 
• We don’t have permission to look at user files / projects individually to train models or improve the offering. 
• We have also negotiated the same with OpenAI, and they won’t retain any data from the customers. 
@Kerry @donagh @peter @Jarett
